heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic Act 1994 (Detention
text_raw:

of Powered Personal Transporters) Regulations 2024.

title: and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), after consultation with
heading: 3. A member of the Garda Síochána is authorised in the case of a powered
text_raw:
3. A member of the Garda Síochána is authorised in the case of a powered 
personal transporter referred to in section 41(1) (as amended by section 32 of the 
Road Traffic and Roads Act 2023 (No. 16 of 2023)) of the Act of 1994 to detain, 
remove and store the powered personal transporter and to make an arrangement 
with any other person for such detention, removal or storage. 

Release of powered personal transporter
text_norm: 3 member garda siochana authorised case powered personal transporter referred section 41(1) (as amended section 32 road traffic road act 2023 (no 16 2023)) act 1994 detain remove store powered personal transporter make arrangement person detention removal storage release powered personal transporter

title: and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), after consultation with
heading: 4. Subject to Regulations 6 and 7, a powered personal transporter which has
text_raw:
4. Subject to Regulations 6 and 7, a powered personal transporter which has 
been detained, removed and stored in accordance with Regulation 3 shall not be 
released until the person claiming the powered personal transporter— 

(a) 

pays the charges in respect of the detention, removal and storage 
of 
in accordance with 
Regulation 5, and 

the powered personal 

transporter 

(b) produces to the member of the Garda Síochána or to the 
authorised agent who is in charge of the place at which the 
powered personal transporter is kept— 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 31st December, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [732] 3 

(i) 

the serial number of the powered personal transporter, or 

(ii) a Garda issued reference number or other such proof of 

ownership of the powered personal transporter. 

Charges for detention, removal and storage

title: and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), after consultation with
heading: 5. (1) Subject to Regulations 6 and 7, where a powered personal transporter
text_raw:
5. (1) Subject to Regulations 6 and 7, where a powered personal transporter 
has been detained, removed and stored in accordance with Regulation 3, the 
owner of the powered personal transporter shall pay to the Commissioner the 
following charges: 

(a) 

€40, in respect of its detention, removal and storage for one day 
or a part of a day, and 

(b) €15, in respect of each further day or part of a day that it is stored. 

(2) A charge under this Regulation may be paid to an authorised agent. 

Waiver of charges
text_norm: 5 (1) subject regulation 6 7 powered personal transporter detained removed stored accordance regulation 3 owner powered personal transporter shall pay commissioner following charge (a) eur40 respect detention removal storage one day part day (b) eur15 respect day part day stored (2) charge regulation may paid authorised agent waiver charge

title: and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), after consultation with
heading: 6. Where a powered personal transporter has been detained, removed and
text_raw:
6. Where a powered personal transporter has been detained, removed and 
stored in accordance with Regulation 3 and the owner of the powered personal 
transporter establishes to the satisfaction of the member of the Garda Síochána 
in charge of the place at which the powered personal transporter is stored that 
the powered personal transporter referred to in section 41(1)(g) of the Act of 
1994, that the powered personal transporter — 

(i) 

had been taken without the owner’s consent, and 

(ii) was being used without the owner’s consent at the time it 

was detained, 

the charges in respect of the detention, removal and storage of the powered 
personal transporter shall be waived. 

Charges where powered personal transporter is abandoned
text_norm: 6 powered personal transporter detained removed stored accordance regulation 3 owner powered personal transporter establishes satisfaction member garda siochana charge place powered personal transporter stored powered personal transporter referred section 41(1)(g) act 1994 powered personal transporter -- (i) taken without owner consent (ii) used without owner consent time detained charge respect detention removal storage powered personal transporter shall waived charge powered personal transporter abandoned

title: and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), after consultation with
heading: 7. Where a powered personal transporter has been detained, removed and
text_raw:
7. Where a powered personal transporter has been detained, removed and 
stored in accordance with Regulation 3 and such powered personal transporter 
was at the time of the detention abandoned or illegally parked, the charges 
specified in Regulation 5 shall not be applied in addition to the application of 
charges specified in regulations made under section 97 of the Road Traffic Act
text_norm: 7 powered personal transporter detained removed stored accordance regulation 3 powered personal transporter time detention abandoned illegally parked charge specified regulation 5 shall applied addition application charge specified regulation made section 97 road traffic act

title: and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), after consultation with
heading: 8. Subject to section 41(3) (as amended by section 90 of the Road Traffic
text_raw:
8. Subject to section 41(3) (as amended by section 90 of the Road Traffic 
Act of 2010 (No. 25 of 2010)) of the Act of 1994, where the owner of a powered 
personal transporter which has been detained, removed and stored in accordance 
with Regulation 3 has not claimed the powered personal transporter or has not 
paid the charges due in accordance with Regulation 5, the Commissioner may 
dispose of the powered personal transporter in any manner he or she thinks fit. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [732] 

Notice of intention to dispose of powered personal transporter
text_norm: 8 subject section 41(3) (as amended section 90 road traffic act 2010 (no 25 2010)) act 1994 owner powered personal transporter detained removed stored accordance regulation 3 claimed powered personal transporter paid charge due accordance regulation 5 commissioner may dispose powered personal transporter manner think fit 4 732 notice intention dispose powered personal transporter

title: and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), after consultation with
heading: 9. Where the Commissioner proposes to dispose of a powered personal
text_raw:
9. Where the Commissioner proposes to dispose of a powered personal 

transporter under Regulation 8, the Commissioner shall— 

(a) 

serve on the owner a notice of intention to dispose of the powered 
personal transporter, or 

(b) where, after reasonable enquiry, it has not been possible to 
ascertain the name and address of the owner of the powered 
personal transporter, publish in at least one daily newspaper 
circulating in the area where the powered personal transporter 
was detained— 

(i) 

(ii) 

a notice of intention to dispose of a number of powered 
personal transporters, and 

 the Internet address of the website where the notice of 
intention to dispose of each powered personal transporter 
may be viewed. 

Claim by owner after disposal
text_norm: 9 commissioner proposes dispose powered personal transporter regulation 8 commissioner shall-- (a) serve owner notice intention dispose powered personal transporter (b) reasonable enquiry possible ascertain name address owner powered personal transporter publish least one daily newspaper circulating area powered personal transporter detained-- (i) (ii) notice intention dispose number powered personal transporter internet address website notice intention dispose powered personal transporter may viewed claim owner disposal

title: and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), after consultation with
heading: 10. Where, before the expiration of the period of one year commencing on
text_raw:
10. Where, before the expiration of the period of one year commencing on 
the date of the disposal of a powered personal transporter by the Commissioner, 
a person satisfies the Commissioner that he or she was the owner of the powered 
personal transporter at the time of its disposal, the Commissioner shall pay him 
or her any proceeds from the disposal less the sum of the charges due for the 
detention, removal and storage of the powered personal transporter and the 
expenses reasonably incurred in the disposal of the powered personal 
transporter. 

Revocation
text_norm: 10 expiration period one year commencing date disposal powered personal transporter commissioner person satisfies commissioner owner powered personal transporter time disposal commissioner shall pay proceeds disposal le sum charge due detention removal storage powered personal transporter expense reasonably incurred disposal powered personal transporter revocation

text_raw:

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport.

title: and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), after consultation with
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide under section 41(1)(g) of the Road Traffic Act 1994 
for Garda seizure and disposal of powered personal transporters used in respect 
of a contravention of regulations made under section 11, or of section 54(1) or 
(2), of the Road Traffic Act 1961. 

These Regulations also revoke the Road Traffic Act 1994 (Detention of Personal 
Powered Transporters) Regulations 2024 (S.I. No. 223 of 2024).
